body_content.explanation: If a smart card (= a plastic card that is used to make payments) is reloadable, you can add more money to the amount that is stored on it:
examples: The company issued reloadable smart cards to all of its customers.
Some re-loadable debit cards put a limit on how much money you can charge to the card each day.

body_content.explanation: If a camera is reloadable, you can take out the film that has been used and put new film into it; if a weapon or the bullets, etc. it uses is reloadable, the bullets can be used again after the weapon is fired:
examples: It is rare to see a reloadable film camera these days.
The army had several reloadable rocket launchers.
